reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major squamous cell neoplasms: cutaneous SCC (~100 per 100k in high-risk populations), lung SCC (~10 per 100k), head/neck SCC (~5 per 100k), esophageal SCC (~3 per 100k), and other sites (~30 per 100k). Global estimate ~150 per 100k with significant geographic variation. Low confidence due to heterogeneity, varying incidence by anatomical site and population ethnicity, and inclusion of both malignant and potentially benign squamous proliferations.
